content: across the mouth with a single length yarn f - see fig 28 3 if you wish with yarn f work a few duplicate stitches for little markings - see fig 29 fig 25 fig 26 fig 27 new born puppy pattern page 51 new born puppy pattern page 52 insert yarn at the nose and through the head to emerge behind the ear - gently pull to squash up the face/ muzzle a little fig 29 fig 28 a note about stuffing you ll see from the photos and the little reel i did on @dotpebbles_knits instagram that there is not loads of stuffing in and around the head and the body just enough to enhance the shaping but not so much as to distort the knitting because it s a puppy she ll need loose flesh to grow into - see fig 30 fig 30 remember to get in touch if you need a little extra advice and of course there is more much more to learn create and be inspired by here @dotpebbles_knits this new born puppy i designed/ made a few changes from the basic puppy pattern which i teach how to make via my domestika course - if you d like to learn more get tips and learn knitting skills then here s the info and if you wish to buy here s a code for 15% off claire_garland-discount please also remember that this pattern like all of my patterns is copyrighted this prohibits copying or reproducing any of its writing content for your own profit however if you want to sell what you ve made from any of my patterns then that is perfectly fine - i actually encourage it and have an instagram account @imadethisrabbit_shop to promote you reach out with #imadethisrabbit_shop and please do share what you ve created from this pattern #dotpebbles_knits #dotpebblescreatureland #imadethispuppy
